Comments_List: Maybe 6-8 hours.
5-10 hours
4h
5 to 10
7 hours
5-10 hrs for homework.
The course materials are very clear and I learned a lot. The instructor is great and helpful.  It may or may not be great to include some other Bayesian frameworks, like variational Bayes.
Really great class. Tremendous lectures and useful homework problems. I would like to see a few more "real world" problems on the homework but other than than I thought the class was great.
The course is well-organized, and I can learn a lot from this course, not only theoretically but also practically.
very nice course

The course covered basic knowledge on Bayesian statistics. The instructor derived the formula by hand, which was easy for me to follow up. Overall, the course was awesome! I was able to understand Bayesian papers after taking this course! I felt so satisfied and happy to take this course!
good pace, great contents
The contents are very good! And it combined concepts and applications.
Great

Strengths are that the instructor did a great job covering different aspects, including the ideas and underlying spirit of Bayesian methods.
Weaknesses are that as Bayesian methods are very much about the applications, it will be great if we practice more on real problems.
Josh is so nice and a great instructor. He always responds to questions very promptly.
Professor Warren is an amazing instructor. His lectures were very very good and he was extremely responsive to email and always supported students when needed.
He is really an expert in the Bayesian field, and I think Josh tried to teach us as much as he can in details. And he would like to answer my questions very patiently. A very great instructor!
Hes excellent!
Really good instructor!
He taught very well! He graded the homework on his own and gave feedbacks, which was very helpful. He was very enthusiastic about the course. I really appreciate it. I enjoyed the course very much!

great teaching
clear structured

maybe can provide a soft copy of the examples written in blackboard so that students don't miss anything

overall great
I like the way Josh taught!!! He is a very good instructor!!!
Josh clearly explain the course material and is very helpful in providing suggestions to projects
Josh is an excellent instructor who gives very clear lectures and patient guidance on projects and homework.
I would definitely recommend this course to fellow students who want to learn more statistics.

A great class if you want to learn more about the theory and algorithms behind Bayesian Statistics. Arguably the best stats class at Yale. Quite challenging so don't take this unless you have a very solid background.
A very good starting course for Bayesian Statistics. Highly recommended!
Highly recommended
Yes. I will definitely recommend it to another student. They will benefit a lot from this course!
highly recommended
It is a very useful course and I would recommend it to another student!
This course gives a comprehensive introduction and some useful practice of Bayesian statistical methods.
